article.headline: Robert Morris 74, Bucknell 67
article.story: CORAOPOLIS, Pa. (AP) -- Maurice Carter had 21 points, including 11 points in the last 10:30, to lift Robert Morris to a 74-67 win over Bucknell on Wednesday. Carter kept the game just out of reach with a 3-pointer after Bucknell (3-9) took a 48-47 lead with 10:24 to play and a layup after the Bison tied the game at 50 with 9:15 to play. After Carter's layup, the Colonials (4-6) never trailed again, spoiling a Bison rally from a 34-29 halftime deficit and preserving their undefeated home record this season. Aaron Thomas had 17 points, while Chaz McCrommon added 15 points and Mark Anderson scored 10 points for Robert Morris. Kevin Bettencourt led Bucknell with 22 points, including six 3-pointers, while Davorin Skornik had 11 points and Chris McNaughton added 10.
